Key Arguments: The proposed bill is seen as a form of censorship reminiscent of historical totalitarian regimes.
The bill is compared to Nazi and Soviet censorship laws, suggesting it could suppress free speech and dissent.
The bill is perceived as a global coordinated effort to control free speech, following similar attempts in other countries.
There is concern about government overreach and the potential for the bill to protect government-approved information while censoring others.
The bill is viewed as harmful to artistic expression and cultural heritage, particularly referencing past suppression of Indigenous voices in Australia.
Notable Quotes: This proposed misinformation and disinformation bill is censorship plain and simple.
If we do not learn from our past we are destined to repeat it.
This bill is abhorrent to free speech in Australia and as it is in conjunction with other nations around the world it is clearly an assault on Free speech globally.
As an artist I find this current bill very disturbing to creation of art another form of free speech that is targeted in the prosed bill.
